answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!The commonest cause of vaginal numbness is thrush or yeast or fungal infection. Other causes are bacterial vaginosis, damage to pudendal nerve, diabetes or peripheral nerve disease. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Do consult her gynecologist.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: my wife and I just had sex this morning and she said she couldn't feel anything like it was totally numb. We have never had that problem before.  What are some possible scenarios as to why this is happening?
title: vaginal numbness
